com.ing.software.ocr

Class ImageProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ing.software.ocr.ImageProcessor

  • public class ImageProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to process an image of a ticket.

    This class behaves like a state machine, the behaviour of a method call depends on which methods were called previously.

    This class is thread safe.

    USAGE CASES:

    Real time visual feedback when framing a ticket:

      Create new ImageProcessor passing a the bitmap of the preview frame.
      Call findTicket(true)
      If findTicket callback has an empty error list, call getCorners() to get the rectangle corners to overlay on top of the preview.
      If the callback list contains CROOKED_TICKET, alert user that the ticket is framed sideways

    User shoots a photo:

      Use ImageProcessor instance of last frame when rectangle was found.
      Call findTicket(false);
      If findTicket callback has an empty error list, proceed to step 5)
      If the callback list contains RECT_NOT_FOUND, let user drag the rectangle corners into position, then proceed to call setCorners().
      Call OcrManager.getTicket passing this ImageProcessor instance. Call undistort() to get the photo of the ticket unwarped.

    New photo imported from storage:

      Same as when user shot a photo, but ImageProcessor must be created with imported photo.

    Load and show photo already processed:

      Create new ImageProcessor passing the photo and the corners.
      Call undistort().
    Author:
    Riccardo Zaglia

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(@NonNull
                     android.graphics.Bitmap bm)
        Set content of internal image buffers. Always call this method before any other image manipulation method.
        Parameters:
        bm - ticket bitmap. Not null.

      • findTicket

        public java.util.List<IPError> findTicket(boolean quick)
        Find the 4 corners of a ticket, ordered counter-clockwise from the top-left corner of the ticket. The corners are ordered to get a straight ticket (but could be upside down).
        Parameters:
        quick -
          true: faster but more inaccurate, good for real time visual feedback.
          false: slower but more accurate, good for recalculating the rectangle after the shot or for analyzing an imported image.
        Returns:
        list of IPError.

        The rectangle corners are always found (unless the error list contains INVALID_CORNERS), but they can be useless, depending on the presence of other errors.

      • findTicket

        public void findTicket(boolean quick,
                       @NonNull
                       com.annimon.stream.function.Consumer<java.util.List<IPError>> callback)
        Asynchronous version of findTicket(boolean). The errors are passed by the callback parameter.
        Parameters:
        quick - true: fast mode; false: slow mode.
        callback - Callback

      • setCorners

        public java.util.List<IPError> setCorners(@NonNull
                                          java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> corners)
        Set pre-calculated ticket rectangle corners.
        Parameters:
        corners - must be 4, ordered counter-clockwise, first is top-left of ticket. Not null.
        Returns:
        List of IPError, can be:
          INVALID_CORNERS: corners are != 4 or not ordered counter-clockwise.

      • getCorners

        public java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> getCorners()
        Get rectangle corners.
        Returns:
        List of corners in bitmap space (range from (0,0) to (width, height) ). The corners should always be 4. Empty if error. Never null.

      • undistort

        public android.graphics.Bitmap undistort(double marginMul,
                                         int shortSide)
        Get a Bitmap of a ticket with a perspective correction applied, with a margin.
        Parameters:
        marginMul - Fraction of length of shortest side of the rectangle of the ticket. A good value is 0.02.
        shortSide - set the shortest side of the output bitmap, the other side is calculated to maintain right aspect ratio. Useful for generating thumbnails. If <=0, the original side length is used.
        Returns:
        Bitmap of ticket with perspective distortion removed. Null if error.

      • undistort

        public android.graphics.Bitmap undistort()
        Convenience overload for undistort(0, 0).
        Returns:
        Bitmap, null if error.

      • undistort

        public void undistort(double marginMul,
                      int shortSide,
                      @NonNull
                      com.annimon.stream.function.Consumer<android.graphics.Bitmap> callback)
        Asynchronous version of undistort(double, int). The bitmap is passed by the callback parameter.
        Parameters:
        marginMul - Margin multiplier
        callback - Callback

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int angle90step)
        Rotate corners, so when undistort is called, the resulting image is rotated according to angle specified.
        Parameters:
        angle90step - integer corresponding to the number of 90 deg turns to apply.
          Positive: clockwise
          Negative: counter clockwise

      • rotate

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap rotate(@NonNull
                                             android.graphics.Bitmap src,
                                             float angle)
        Rotate a bitmap.
        Parameters:
        src - Source bitmap. Not null.
        angle - Rotation angle (degrees).
        Returns:
        Rotated bitmap.

      • transform

        public static java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> transform(java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> points,
                                                                java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> srcRect,
                                                                java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> dstRect)
        Apply perspective transform to a collection of points.
        Parameters:
        points - Points to be transformed.
        srcRect - Reference rectangle.
        dstRect - Distorted reference rectangle.
        Returns:
        Output distorted points. Empty if error.

      • expandRectCoordinates

        public static android.graphics.RectF expandRectCoordinates(android.graphics.RectF normalizedRect,
                                                           android.util.SizeF bmSize,
                                                           double marginMul)
        Expand normalized rectangle to desired destination space
        Parameters:
        normalizedRect - total rectangle obtained from OcrTicket
        bmSize - target image size
        marginMul - same margin multiplier passed to undistort.
        Returns:
        rectangle in destination space
